list_definition.definition: a country’s warships and the people who work in and with them

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Russia has one of the largest navies in the world
I joined the navy fifteen years ago.

list_definition.definition: (also adjective) (also navy blue) (of) a dark blue colour/color

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: These sweatshirts come in white or navy (blue).

list_ex_of_english: At another level, two other figures appeared to provide the strategic and political rationale for the new navy.
Furthermore, the navies of the world have an increasing rôle to play in the growing electronic battle of intelligence and counter-intelligence.
You see there is a pretense this is just a naval station and you never know which is the pretense: spaceship or navy.
The experience and expertise that we have acquired have been put at the disposal of the navies of other countries in the past.
Without going into the motives of other nations, the hard fact remains that other navies do exist in the world.
Meanwhile, the gap between the two navies widens and the balance goes more and more against us.
Also, an expanding navy would require coaling stations and bases in distant lands.
The first is a fight between the two navies.
